means: 筛（煤、矿石等）( screen的现在分词 )

word_mean: 筛选〔检查〕：通过检查或试验，从人群中找出罹患某种疾病、缺陷或属于某种疾病高危组的人
根据物料通过和不通过筛孔，将物料按粒度分成不同粒级的作业。按是否借助水的冲洗作用分，有“湿法筛分(wet screening)”和“干法筛分(dry screening)”两种。
用筛筛去混在药材中的杂质的净制方法。亦指将药物按大小用筛分开。

sentence.Network_en: TV firms were later banned from screening any pictures of the demo.
sentence.Network_cn: 后来各电视台被禁止播放任何有关这次游行的画面。

sentence.Network_en: The airline had been screening baggage on X-ray machines.
sentence.Network_cn: 该航空公司已采用X光机对行李进行安全检查。

sentence.Network_en: Britain has an enviable record on breast screening for cancer.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国妇女的乳腺癌患病率很低，着实令人羡慕。

entry.tran: (电视、电脑的)屏幕;(电影的)银幕
entry.def: A screen is a flat vertical surface on which pictures or words are shown. Television sets and computers have screens, and films are shown on a screen in cinemas.
You can refer to film or television as the screen .

example.ex: Many viewers have strong opinions about violence on the screen...
example.tran: 许多观众对银幕暴力心存反感。

example.ex: She was the ideal American teenager, both on and off screen.
example.tran: 无论是在荧幕上还是在生活中，她都是人们心目中完美的美国青少年。

entry.tran: 放映(电影);播放(电视节目)
entry.def: When a film or a television programme is screened, it is shown in the cinema or broadcast on television.

example.ex: The series is likely to be screened in January...
example.tran: 这个系列剧可能在 1 月份播放。

example.ex: TV firms were later banned from screening any pictures of the demo.
example.tran: 后来各电视台被禁止播放任何有关这次游行的画面。

entry.def: A screen is a vertical panel which can be moved around. It is used to keep cold air away from part of a room, or to create a smaller area within a room.

example.ex: They put a screen in front of me so I couldn't see what was going on.
example.tran: 他们在我面前竖了一面屏风，所以我看不到发生了什么事情。

entry.def: If something is screened by another thing, it is behind it and hidden by it.

example.ex: Most of the road behind the hotel was screened by a block of flats.
example.tran: 宾馆后面的那条路大部分被一片公寓楼遮住了。

entry.tran: 检查，筛查(以确定是否患病)
entry.def: To screen for a disease means to examine people to make sure that they do not have it.

example.ex: ...a quick saliva test that would screen for people at risk of tooth decay.
example.tran: 能快速核查是否长蛀牙的唾液检验

entry.def: When an organization screens people who apply to join it, it investigates them to make sure that they are not likely to cause problems.

example.ex: They will screen all their candidates.
example.tran: 他们会对所有求职者进行筛选。

entry.tran: 对(人、行李)进行安全检查
entry.def: To screen people or luggage means to check them using special equipment to make sure they are not carrying a weapon or a bomb.

example.ex: The airline had been screening baggage on X-ray machines.
example.tran: 该航空公司已采用X光机对行李进行安全检查。

entry.tran: 转接，甄别(来电以决定是否接听)
entry.def: If you screen your telephone calls, calls made to you are connected to an answering machine or are answered by someone else, so that you can choose whether or not to speak to the people phoning you.

example.ex: I employ a secretary to screen my calls.
example.tran: 我雇用了一名秘书转接打给我的电话。

means.word_mean: 1. the display of a motion picture
2. fabric of metal or plastic mesh
3. the act of concealing the existence of something by obstructing the view of it;

sentences.sentence: "the cover concealed their guns from enemy aircraft"

means.word_mean: 4. testing objects or persons in order to identify those with particular characteristics

auth_sentence.res_content: He didn't make it through the screening process.

Sentence.sentence: With the percentage of people over age 65 expected to nearly double by 2050, it's important to weigh the health benefits of screening against the risks and costs of routine testing.
In many cases, screening can lead to surgeries to remove cancer, while the cancers themselves may be slow-growing and may not pose serious health problems in patients' remaining years

But the message that everyone must screen for cancer has become so deep-rooted that when health care experts recommended that women under 50 and over 74 stop screening for breast cancer, it caused a riotous reaction among doctors, patients and advocacy groups.
What's more, grades are not only an educational device but are also part of a screening system to help assign kids to their next class or program.
